answer: The number of vehicles passing a point per unit time, typically measured in vehicles per hour.

The number of vehicles occupying a unit length of roadway, typically per kilometer or mile.
A key objective measuring the consistency and predictability of journey times for users.
The average speed of vehicles passing a fixed point over a specified time period.
A system using technology and strategies to monitor, control, and manage traffic flow.
Application of information technology to improve transportation safety and mobility.
The maximum density where traffic flow halts, usually occurring in a complete standstill.
Simulates individual vehicle movements and interactions based on car-following theories.
The average speed of vehicles over a specific section of road at an instant.
A disturbance in traffic flow that propagates through a stream of vehicles, like a slowdown.

A qualitative measure describing operational conditions within a traffic stream.
A primary objective to reduce the frequency and severity of traffic collisions.
The distance between the front bumpers of two successive vehicles on the road.
An objective to reduce environmental impacts like emissions and fuel consumption.
The average speed of vehicles when drivers are not constrained by other vehicles.

The time interval between two successive vehicles passing a fixed point.

To maximize the movement of people and goods using existing infrastructure.
The maximum sustainable flow rate a roadway can handle under given conditions.
A microscopic model describing how one vehicle follows another in a traffic stream.

The rate of motion of a vehicle, typically measured as distance per unit time.
The equivalent hourly rate at which vehicles pass a point during a time interval.

Signs, signals, markings, and other devices used to regulate traffic.

The ability of traffic to resist the formation and growth of disturbances.
A location where roadway capacity is reduced, causing congestion and queues.

Macroscopic models describing the collective behavior of traffic as a fluid.

The core relationship in traffic flow theory, forming the fundamental diagram.

The total yearly traffic volume at a location divided by 365 days.

Traffic signals that change timing based on vehicle detection.

Electronic signs used to provide real-time information to drivers.

When a queue from an intersection blocks upstream intersections.

A traffic control system using signals to regulate entry onto freeways.

The body of knowledge describing the movement of vehicles and their interactions.
